game

Class Main

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • game.Game
                • game.Main
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class Main
extends Game
    This is the main class that is used to run the whole game and has the functionality of the zombies, bullets, player and etc. It is used to access the other classes either as an array or as its own entity.
    Author:
    Stefan Mitic, Alex Chan, Sowon Ham
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Main()
      The default constructor for the main game.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void act()
      When the game begins, this method will automatically be executed every millisecond This may be used as a control method for checking user input and collision between any game objects
      void bullets()
      The mechanics behind the arrays of bullets and direction detection of the bullets firing.
      void directionReset()
      The method for allowing directions to reset for players and bullet directions.
      void mapSetup()
      The method for map setup where it sets the borders that zombies and players cannot go through.
      void player()
      The method for setting up the player.
      void playerHealth()
      The health detection for the player when it collides with any type of zombies.
      void playerLocation()
      This method allows for the zombie to get the location of the player.
      void playerMovement()
      The movement detection for player when WASD keys are pressed with a final speed.
      void score()
      Sets up the score board for both players and checks for the winner
      void scoreChange()
      The method for score changing when another highscore is reached with a different player.
      void setup()
      When implemented, this will allow the programmer to initialize the game before it begins running Adding objects to the game and setting their initial positions should be done here.
      void zombieBulletCollision()
      The method for zombie's health decrease and recoil function when bullet collides with zombies.
      void zombieCollision()
      The method for zombie collision where they cannot overlap each other.
      void zombieHealthDetection()
      The health detection for zombies where each bullet counts as one damage.
      void zombies()
      The actual spawning of zombies and the locations called from another class and round display function.
